descriptions: Writing lacks clarity and coherence; ideas are disjointed and difficult to follow.
Writing demonstrates minimal clarity and coherence; ideas are somewhat connected but often unclear.
Writing demonstrates some clarity and coherence; ideas are generally connected but may have some confusing parts.
Writing is mostly clear and coherent; ideas are logically connected and easy to follow for the most part.
Writing is clear and coherent; ideas are logically connected and easy to follow.
Writing is exceptionally clear and coherent; ideas are logically and fluidly connected, enhancing the overall impact.
Ideas are undeveloped and lack supporting evidence.
Ideas are minimally developed with limited supporting evidence.
Ideas are somewhat developed with some supporting evidence.
Ideas are adequately developed with relevant supporting evidence.
Ideas are well-developed with strong and relevant supporting evidence.
Ideas are exceptionally well-developed with compelling and insightful supporting evidence.
Writing lacks organization; ideas are presented randomly.
Writing demonstrates minimal organization; ideas are loosely grouped.
Writing demonstrates some organization; ideas are grouped but may lack logical order.
Writing is mostly organized; ideas are logically sequenced for the most part.
Writing is well-organized; ideas are logically sequenced and presented.
Writing is exceptionally well-organized; ideas are presented in a sophisticated and effective manner.
Writing style is inappropriate for the task, purpose, and audience.
Writing style is minimally appropriate for the task, purpose, and audience.
Writing style is somewhat appropriate for the task, purpose, and audience.
Writing style is mostly appropriate for the task, purpose, and audience.
Writing style is appropriate for the task, purpose, and audience.
Writing style is highly effective and enhances the impact for the task, purpose, and audience.
